original: Takuma is a junior high school student.
slashSplit: Takuma is a junior high school student.
parenSplit: Takuma is a junior high school student.
vocabularySplit: + Takuma / + is / + a / + junior / + high / + school / + student / .

original: One Saturday, he saw a television news story about food shortages.
slashSplit: One Saturday, / he saw a television news story / about food shortages.
parenSplit: One Saturday, he saw a television news story about food shortages.
vocabularySplit: + One / + Saturday / , / + he / + saw / + a / + television / + news / + story / + about food shortages / .

original: He learned that a lot of people around the world can't get enough food to eat.
slashSplit: He learned / that a lot of people / around the world can't get enough food / to eat.
parenSplit: He learned (that a lot of people <around the world can>'t get enough food to eat).
vocabularySplit: + He / + learned / + that / + a lot of / + people / + around / + the / + world / + can't / + get / + enough / + food / + to eat / .

original: He knows that some countries have enough food.
slashSplit: He knows / that some countries have enough food.
parenSplit: He knows (that some countries have enough food).
vocabularySplit: + He / + knows / + that / + some / + countries / + have / + enough / + food / .

original: He thought, "Why are people in so many countries hungry?
slashSplit: He thought, / "Why are people / in so many countries hungry?
parenSplit: He thought, "Why are people <in so many> countries hungry?
vocabularySplit: + He / + thought / , / + "Why / + are / + people / + in so many countries hungry / ?

original: That evening on the Internet, Takuma studied about food shortages.
slashSplit: That evening / on the Internet, / Takuma studied / about food shortages.
parenSplit: (That evening <on the Internet>), Takuma studied about food shortages.
vocabularySplit: + That / + evening / + on the Internet / , / + Takuma / + studied / + about food shortages / .

original: He learned that one of the reasons for food shortages is bad weather.
slashSplit: He learned / that one / of the reasons / for food shortages / is bad weather.
parenSplit: He learned (that one <of the reasons for food> shortages is bad weather).
vocabularySplit: + He / + learned / + that / + one / + of / + the / + reasons / + for food shortages is bad weather / .

original: In some countries, it doesn't rain much or it rains too much.
slashSplit: In some countries, / it doesn't rain much / or it rains too much.
parenSplit: <In some countries>, it doesn't rain much or it rains too much.
vocabularySplit: + In some countries / , / + it / + doesn't / + rain / + much / + or / + it / + rains / + too / + much / .

original: The people who live in such countries can't get enough food.
slashSplit: The people / who live / in such countries can't get enough food.
parenSplit: The people who live <in such countries> can't get enough food.
vocabularySplit: + The / + people / + who / + live / + in such countries can't get enough food / .

original: When it doesn't rain, farm products don't grow well.
slashSplit: When it doesn't rain, / farm products don't grow well.
parenSplit: (When it doesn't rain), farm products don't grow well.
vocabularySplit: + When / + it / + doesn't / + rain / , / + farm / + products / + don't / + grow / + well / .

original: When it rains too much, the products are damaged.
slashSplit: When it rains too much, / the products are damaged.
parenSplit: (When it rains too much), the products are damaged.
vocabularySplit: + When / + it / + rains / + too / + much / , / + the / + products / + are / + damaged / .

original: It isn't easy for the people to get food.
slashSplit: It isn't easy / for the people / to get food.
parenSplit: It isn't easy <for the people> to get> food.
vocabularySplit: + It / + isn't / + easy / + for the people / + to / + get / + food / .

original: The next day, Takuma went to the library near his house to learn more about food shortages.
slashSplit: The next day, / Takuma went / to the library / near his house / to learn more / about food shortages.
parenSplit: The next day, Takuma went <to the library near his> house to learn more about food shortages.
vocabularySplit: + The / + next / + day / , / + Takuma / + went / + to / + the / + library / + near his house / + to / + learn / + more / + about food shortages / .

original: He read some books about the food problem.
slashSplit: He read some books / about the food problem.
parenSplit: He read some books <about the food problem>.
vocabularySplit: + He / + read / + some / + books / + about the food problem / .

original: From one book, he learned that there is another reason.
slashSplit: From one book, / he learned / that there is another reason.
parenSplit: From one book, he learned (that there is another reason).
vocabularySplit: + From one book / , / + he / + learned / + that / + there / + is / + another / + reason / .

original: People in some countries are so poor that they can't buy enough food to eat.
slashSplit: People / in some countries / are so poor / that they can't buy enough food / to eat.
parenSplit: People <in some countries> are so poor (that they can't buy enough food to eat).
vocabularySplit: + People / + in some countries are / + so / + poor / + that / + they / + can't / + buy / + enough / + food / + to eat / .

original: He was sad to learn that.
slashSplit: He was sad / to learn that.
parenSplit: He was sad to learn that.
vocabularySplit: + He / + was / + sad / + to / + learn / + that / .

original: That evening, Takuma told his parents and his grandmother about that.
slashSplit: That evening, / Takuma told his parents / and his grandmother / about that.
parenSplit: (That evening), Takuma told his parents and his grandmother about that.
vocabularySplit: + That / + evening / , / + Takuma / + told / + his / + parents / + and / + his / + grandmother / + about that / .

original: His grandmother said "Takuma, you know there is a lot of food to eat in Japan.
slashSplit: His grandmother said "Takuma, / you know / there is a lot of food / to eat / in Japan.
parenSplit: His grandmother said "Takuma, you know there is a lot of food to eat <in Japan>.
vocabularySplit: + His / + grandmother / + said / + "Takuma / , / + you / + know / + there / + is / + a lot of / + food / + to / + eat / + in Japan / .

original: We can eat enough food every day.
slashSplit: We can eat enough food every day.
parenSplit: We can eat enough food every day.
vocabularySplit: + We / + can / + eat / + enough / + food / + every day / .

original: When we eat dinner at home, your mother often tells you to eat all the food on your plate.
slashSplit: When we eat dinner / at home, / your mother often tells you / to eat all the food / on your plate.
parenSplit: (When we eat dinner <at home>), your mother often tells you to eat all the food <on your plate>.
vocabularySplit: + When / + we / + eat / + dinner / + at home / , / + your / + mother / + often / + tells / + you / + to / + eat / + all / + the / + food / + on your plate / .

original: " He thought his grandmother was right.
slashSplit: " He thought / his grandmother was right.
parenSplit: " He thought his grandmother was right.
vocabularySplit: + " / + He / + thought / + his / + grandmother / + was / + right / .

original: He said to his mother, "OK, Mom, I will try to eat all the food on my plate because I don't want to waste food.
slashSplit: He said / to his mother, / "OK, Mom, I will try to eat all the food / on my plate because I don't want to waste food.
parenSplit: He said <to his mother>, "OK, Mom, I will try to eat all the food <on my plate> (because I don't want to waste food).
vocabularySplit: + He / + said / + to / + his / + mother / , / + "OK / , / + Mom / , / + I / + will / + try / + to / + eat / + all / + the / + food / + on my plate / + because / + I / + don't / + want to / + waste / + food / .

original: On Monday, at school he made a speech in class about food shortages.
slashSplit: On Monday, / at school he made a speech / in class / about food shortages.
parenSplit: On Monday, <at school> he made a speech <in class about> food shortages.
vocabularySplit: + On Monday / , / + at school he made a speech / + in class / + about food shortages / .

original: He said, "What can we do to help hungry people around the world?
slashSplit: He said, / "What can we do / to help hungry people / around the world?
parenSplit: He said, "What can we do to help hungry people <around the world>?
vocabularySplit: + He / + said / , / + "What / + can / + we / + do / + to / + help / + hungry / + people / + around the world / ?

original: There are ways to help them.
slashSplit: There are ways / to help them.
parenSplit: There are ways to help them.
vocabularySplit: + There / + are / + ways / + to / + help / + them / .

original: For example, we can send them food because we have a lot of food in Japan.
slashSplit: For example, / we can send them food because we have a lot of food / in Japan.
parenSplit: For example, we can send them food (because we have a lot of food <in Japan>).
vocabularySplit: + For example / , / + we / + can / + send / + them / + food / + because / + we / + have / + a lot of / + food / + in Japan / .

original: You think sending food isn't easy, right?
slashSplit: You think sending food isn't easy, / right?
parenSplit: You think sending food isn't easy, right?
vocabularySplit: + You / + think / + sending / + food / + isn't / + easy / , / + right / ?

original: Then we can do more.
slashSplit: Then we can do more.
parenSplit: Then we can do more.
vocabularySplit: + Then / + we / + can / + do / + more / .

original: It's sending money to them.
slashSplit: It's sending money / to them.
parenSplit: It's sending money <to them>.
vocabularySplit: + It's / + sending / + money / + to them / .

original: Sending money is easier than sending food.
slashSplit: Sending money is easier than sending food.
parenSplit: Sending money is easier than sending food.
vocabularySplit: + Sending / + money / + is / + easier / + than sending food / .

original: We can look for other ways to help hungry people around the world on the Internet or in books.
slashSplit: We can look / for other ways / to help hungry people / around the world / on the Internet / or / in books.
parenSplit: We can look <for other ways> to help hungry people <around the world on the> Internet or in books.
vocabularySplit: + We / + can / + look / + for other ways / + to / + help / + hungry / + people / + around / + the / + world / + on the Internet / + or / + in books / .

original: We should also try to learn the causes of the food problem.
slashSplit: We should also try to learn the causes / of the food problem.
parenSplit: We should also try to learn the causes <of the food problem>.
vocabularySplit: + We / + should / + also / + try / + to / + learn / + the / + causes / + of the food problem / .

original: Now, Takuma is more interested in the food problem of the world.
slashSplit: Now, / Takuma is more interested / in the food problem / of the world.
parenSplit: Now, Takuma is more interested <in the food> problem of> the world.
vocabularySplit: + Now / , / + Takuma / + is / + more / + interested / + in the food problem / + of the world / .

original: He wants the students of his school to think about the problem with him.
slashSplit: He wants the students / of his school / to think / about the problem / with him.
parenSplit: He wants the students <of his school to think> <about the problem with him>.
vocabularySplit: + He / + wants / + the / + students / + of / + his / + school / + to think / + about / + the / + problem / + with him / .

original: He decided to make a school newspaper and write about it.
slashSplit: He decided / to make a school newspaper / and write / about it.
parenSplit: He decided to make a school newspaper and write about it.
vocabularySplit: + He / + decided / + to / + make / + a / + school / + newspaper / + and / + write / + about it / .

original: He thinks, "More students of my school will start to become interested in the problem if they read about it in the school newspaper.
slashSplit: He thinks, / "More students / of my school will start / to become interested / in the problem if they read / about it / in the school newspaper.
parenSplit: He thinks, "More students <of my school will start> to become interested <in the problem> if they> read about it <in the school> newspaper>.

original: countries.
slashSplit: countries.
parenSplit: countries.
vocabularySplit: + countries / .

original: We can do many things to help them.
